pull.title: doc: warn that ranged multi() descriptors are not BIP67 compatible
pull.body: This adds a quick warning to the `deriveaddresses` RPC help, and a more detailed explanation to `descriptors.md`. Personally I'm not a huge fan of [BIP67](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0067.mediawiki) as it is. It results in a different ordering for each deriviation index, depending on the public keys at that index. I would prefer to order all derived addresses by BIP32 master fingerprint.

[doc] warn that ranged multi() descriptors are not BIP67 compatible

events.message: [doc] warn that ranged multi() descriptors are not BIP67 compatible

events.body: `multi67()` or something doesn't sound like a bad idea to consider supporting in the future

@sipa any thoughts on such a `multi67()` descriptor? It seems that at least Electrum and ColdCard use [BIP67](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0067.mediawiki) in the wild. It would be the same as `multi()` but at every index the public keys are ordered canonically.

I think adding a multi_bip67 descriptor fragment or so makes perfect sense; it's easy to do, and composes fine with other things.

One issue is that the script-to-descriptor inference code cannot guess multi vs multi_bip67.
@achow101 textually committed to trying to get an implementation out

Having a deriveaddresses RPC example could still be useful. Will rebase.
